newsitem.title: CHINA: China should issue more corporate bonds -- paper.
newsitem.headline: China should issue more corporate bonds -- paper.

text.p: China should allow issue of more corporate bonds, especially by hydropower firms in south and central provinces, and let insurance firms and pension funds into the secondary market, China Securities said on Wednesday.

Chinese entities are expected to issue 20-30 billion yuan in corporate bonds in 1996, almost double the 1995 amount, but the amount is far below the 220 billion yuan in treasure bonds to be issued in the same period, the newspaper said.
It said China should also set up its own system of assessment and registration of the bonds.
China should let insurance companies and pension funds into the secondary market to help develop the bond market, it said but gave no more details.
One Chinese banker said that Beijing wanted to encourage more of the vast pool of individual bank savings to flow into company bonds and equities.
